title: libGL.so is not installed in lib on Ubuntu 18.04
body:
When trying to install paraview using system opengl I am getting the following error:

```console
spack install -j40 paraview+python

==> Error: AttributeError: Query of package 'opengl' for 'libs' failed
prefix : /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu
spec : opengl@4.5.0%gcc@7.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64
queried as : opengl
extra parameters : []

/home/danlipsa/projects/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:782, in child_process:
        779            tb_string = traceback.format_exc()
        780
        781            # build up some context from the offending package so we can
  >>    782            # show that, too.
        783            package_context = get_package_context(tb)
        784
        785            build_log = None
```

This is what I have in my packages.yaml

```console
packages:
   opengl:
     paths:
       opengl@4.5.0: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu
     buildable: False
   python:
      version: [3, 2]
```

The issue is that spack add the postfix 'lib' to the directory specified inside packages.yaml
Note that the message printed is also confusing as it talks about 'libs', but spack expects a lib directory.

An workaround is to create a directory with a subdirectory 'lib' that points to where libGL.so is:
```console
[~/spack-opengl]$ pwd
/home/danlipsa/spack-opengl
[~/spack-opengl]$ ls -l lib
lrwxrwxrwx 1 danlipsa danlipsa 25 May 29 12:52 lib -> /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu
[~/spack-opengl]$ 
```
and then replace the directory specified in packages.yaml with ```/home/danlipsa/spack-opengl```
